Explore the different APIs needed to make any layout fully accessible
String description used by the talkback when the component receives focus.
The next image has the contentDescription set by xml
The next image has the contentDescription set by code
The next image does not have contentDescription
Param needed to manage the navigation order of the different layout components.
The navigation in the first three elements is set by xml. The rest is set in the activity, by code. Since api 23 its possible to use xml and code without any restriction
This params are needed to manage the navigation when the user has peripheral controllers, such as external keyboards, switches, and more.
Param needed to notify talkback if the component/layout could be focuseable and/or read by the accessibility services.
This layout is marked as not important by xml with value "noHideDescendants", therefore it will not be read nor selectable, neither his child views.
This layout is marked as not important by code with value "no", therefore it will not be read nor selectable, but some of his childs will.
This layout is marked as important by code with value "yes", therefore its content description will be read when selected. Some of the childs will also be read when selected.
Param needed to notify talkback that every time the view that applies this attribute changes, the user must be notified.
This parameter indicates that every time the component changes, the talkback will notify the user. In this case, the value is set in the textView by xml (assertive).
In this case, the value is set in the activity, by code (polite).

The difference between assertive and polite live regions relies in the urgency to notify the changes. In case the talkback is already talking, the announcement emitted by an assertive region will interrupt the previous message to be read right away, while the announcement emitted by a polite region will wait until the end of the previous message before being read.
API used to send on demand messages to the talkback.
In cases when is necessary to inform the talkback about certain events fired via a particular action, a message can be sent by using this API.
API used to indicate that a view is a heading. This is used to allow the user to skip entire sections of content when navigating.
Grouping of views with shared meaning

We talk about semantic views when we wrap two or more views who share meaning. This way, the Talkback presents them to the user as an unique element. This reduces the amount of noise and makes the app navigation more straightforward and less frustrating.
In this case, we present three views who share meaning but are separated and not configured to be displayead as semantic views.
Now, the same views as semantic views.
Top app. More than five thousand downloads.
Badges are small units of information that allow you to indicate the state of an element or differentiate several similar elements from each other.
The buttons allow you to `carry` out the main and secondary actions of a screen.\nThey are applied in different places in the UI such as cards, manners and forms.
The buttons has a function that allow you to show a progress indicator determinate to provide feedback to a user after he make an action with the button.
Andes card with title, style elevated, hierarchy primary, type warning, padding small and with action link.
Andes card with title, hierarchy secondary and padding small.
Andes card with title, style outline, hierarchy primary, type none, padding medium and with action link.
Andes card without title, style outline, hierarchy primary, type highlight, padding small and without action link.
Andes card with title, hierarchy secondary_dark and padding medium.

They allow multiple selections from a list of options, unlike radio buttons that only allow you to choose a single option.

This trigger is generally applied for form completion, that\'s why his style is aligned to the text field. They are usually used both for simple selections with few options and for more complex and extensive selections and options.
They apply anywhere on the interface. By default they show a selected option and do not allow it to be empty. There are 3 sizes.
Set a Dropdown Searchbox Placeholder text‚Ä¶
They are rows ordered vertically in a sequential way, with similar content and format. They allow you to display information, operate, navigate or select between different options.
The purpose of a message is to highlight information on the screen.
Para que puedas coordinar la entrega, enviamos los datos de contacto del vendedor a tu e-mail. Si no recibiste el correo, clicke√° en Reenviar.
Alcanzaste el nivel 6. Ten√©s env√≠os gratis en tus pr√≥ximas ventas.

Ingres√° en Mis Datos y revis√° tu direcci√≥n de entrega. Sin este dato no podremos realizar el env√≠o. Tambi√©n pod√©s revisar nuestras preguntas frecuentes para saber c√≥mo debe ser el formato.
linear progress indicator ( determinate ). If the status of the process is detectable, the indicator expresses its completeness between 0% (incomplete or empty) and 100% (complete or full).
They allow you to make a selection from a list of options. Unlike checkboxes, radio buttons only allow you to choose an option.
Component used to improve the selection of options in dropdown menus when the number of menu items is very large.
Allows the user to inmediately turn ON or OFF a preference or functionality.
They communicate quickly and concisely the status of an event. For more complex or extensive communications, consider the use of tooltip or message.
Tags are compact components that represent complex information in a summarized way. Allowing users to make selections, enter information, or filter content.
They allow you to organize content by grouping information into different sections. Sections are displayed one at a time headed by precise and concise labels.
Allows the user to enter and edit text values.
show and hide icon when type.
Simulates server calls for updating the suggestions after user writes
They are containers that specify images, logos and icons for complementary content and modified meaning. When grouped together, they improve the scannability of the information.
Hierarchy: Quiet, Size: 24, State: Disabled, Type: Icon
Hierarchy: Loud, Size: 48, State: Enabled, Type: Icon
Hierarchy: Default, Size: 64, State: Enabled, Type: Icon
Hierarchy: Quiet, Size: 80, State: Enabled, Type: Icon
Hierarchy: Default, Size: 64, State: Enabled, Type: Image Circle
Hierarchy: Default, Size: 64, State: Enabled, Type: Image Square
A slider is a control that allows you to make a quick selection within a defined range of values. üìò
It is a pop-up notification that allows you to expand the information about a specific element.\nFor more general notifications consider the use of snackbar or message.
From 0 to 100 where 0 is left and 100 right
Why do we need this data?
How do we calculate the credit?
How do we calculate the average?
In this section you can check your current sales values. All the data integrated into one common section.
It is a card superimposed on the rest of the content that shows lists with actionable or selectable rows.

When there is no space available to the left, even if the menu has orientation = LEFT, the component will inflate with orientation = RIGHT. If rows = MAX and the containing list has enough elements, the component will extend until the inferior limit of the container view.
Values: orientation = LEFT, width = 380, rows = MEDIUM
When there is no space available to the right, even if the menu has orientation = RIGHT, the component will inflate with orientation = LEFT.
If the component has rows = MAX and the containing list has enough elements, the component will extend until the inferior limit of the container view.
If the menu has rows = MEDIUM and there is not enough space for this config, the component will inflate upwards.
If the menu has rows = SMALL or the list has few elements and there is enough space for this config, the component will inflate downwards.
This component allows the selection of time or time ranges.
Must respect the time interval set
BadgeComponent: Dot, Type: Image Circle, Size: 32, BadgeType: Error
BadgeComponent: Icon Pill, Type: Icon, Size: 48, BadgeType: Highlight
BadgeComponent: Pill, Type: Icon, Size: 56, BadgeType: Highlight
It is used to refer to the value of an item or a specific amount of money.
A screen that shows the result of a flow or a group of tasks.
Component that inherits from the OS counterpart (intends to be an immediate replacement for the native TextView)
Allows the user to enter and edit money amounts and percentages in a field defined as the main screen action
Component NOT recommended to use in webviews.
AndesButtonGroup is a container for AndesButton. They allow you to add 1 to 3 buttons distributed horizontally, vertically, auto and mixed.
A modal represents a block of information presented in foreground, isolating the screen content and capturing the full attention of the user.
